articles.summary: 480 victims were duped into sending money to the fraudsters over the last half-year. The majority of reports came from people aged 56 or above. The most common scam involves impersonating the FCA and getting people to hand over funds or sensitive information.

articles.title: Thousands targeted by fraudsters impersonating financial regulator
articles.author: PA News Agency
articles.summary: The watchdog received 4,465 reports of fraudsters pretending to be the FCA in the first half of the year. Around 480 victims were duped into sending money to the fraudsters. The majority of reports came from people aged 56 or above. The most common scam involves fraudsters claiming that the regulator has recovered funds from a crypto wallet that was opened illegally in the individual's name.
